title: Family shares moment with daughter after dream school acceptance
description: Anderson Cooper showcases family moments from viewers, including one father witnessing when his daughter got accepted into her dream school. Watch "Full Circle" every Monday, Tuesday and Friday at 6pm E.T.

title: Second giant 'murder hornet' escapes after it was captured by scientists in Washington
description: Another "murder" hornet that could have led scientists to its nest has evaded experts once more, following a lost signal.

title: Obama to hit the campaign trail for Biden in final stretch
description: Former President Barack Obama is expected to hit the campaign trail next week, Democratic officials tell CNN, as he looks to step up his work in support of his one-time partner -- former Vice President Joe Biden -- in the final stretch of the election.

title: Utah hiker shares what he was thinking when he faced cougar
description: Hiker Kyle Burgess tells CNN's Anderson Cooper what was going through his mind when encountered a cougar that stalked him for six minutes on a trail in Utah. Watch "Full Circle" ever Monday, Tuesday and Friday at 6pm E.T.

title: 10 people have died in Nigeria's ongoing protests over police brutality, Amnesty International says
description: At least 10 people have died in protests over police brutality in Nigeria, Amnesty International said Tuesday.

title: CNN's Dana Bash: This moment will impress both Democrats and Republicans
description: CNN's Dana Bash discusses a moment from Judge Amy Coney Barrett's Supreme Court confirmation hearing where she raises an empty notepad after being asked if she had taken any notes.

title: Lonely Planet ranks ultimate travel destinations in new list
description: Many of us have been forced to rethink travel plans in the wake of Covid-19, but if you're soothing your canceled-vacation-blues by daydreaming about future adventures, Lonely Planet's new "Ultimate Travel List" might be just what you need.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo tests positive for coronavirus
description: Cristiano Ronaldo has tested positive for coronavirus, the Portuguese Football Federation said in a statement Tuesday.

title: Fauci says he's 'not going to walk away' as Trump revives criticism
Feinstein grills Barrett on Roe v. Wade at confirmation hearing: 'It's distressing not to get a straight answer'
Kanye West and other stars join global protests over police brutality in Nigeria
description: US rapper Kanye West has joined a growing list of international celebrities speaking out in support of large protests against police brutality in Nigeria.

title: Facebook donates $1.3 million to boost WWII code-breaking site Bletchley Park
description: Facebook has made a £1 million ($1.3 million) donation to the museum at Bletchley Park, where British code-breakers decrypted messages sent using Nazi Germany's Enigma cipher and contributed to an Allied victory in World War II, after the site was forced to cut dozens of jobs as a result of the pandemic.

title: The 10 Senate seats most likely to flip, 3 weeks from Election Day
description: It's been a rough couple of weeks for President Donald Trump, and that's squeezing some GOP senators who were already facing competitive reelections.

title: Cougar stalks and lunges at Utah hiker
description: Utah hiker Kyle Burgess captured this dramatic video of his dangerous encounter with a cougar.

title: Turkey issues detention warrants for 167 over suspected Gulen links, state media reports
description: Turkish police detained dozens of people on Tuesday in a search for 167 suspects, many of them active duty soldiers, in a move against supporters of a Muslim preacher the government accuses of organizing a failed coup in 2016, state media reported.

title: Fauci reacts to Trump ad: This is disappointing
description: Dr. Anthony Fauci told CNN's Jake Tapper the Trump campaign should remove their ad featuring his comments which he says were used out of context.

title: The fried chicken sandwich with a claw
description: The claw! The claw!

title: Senator repeatedly presses Amy Coney Barrett on Roe v. Wade case
description: Sen. Dianne Feinstein (D-CA) repeatedly questions Supreme Court nominee Amy Coney Barrett on whether she believes Roe v. Wade was wrongly decided.

title: 'Lies kill': Van Jones calls out Giuliani's false claim to Trump supporters
description: CNN's Van Jones reacted to President Trump's personal attorney Rudy Giuliani falsely claiming people don't die of coroanvirus anymore.

title: Justin Bieber launches Crocs collection
description: This year has certainly been unexpected, and what better icing on the cake than Justin Bieber launching his new collection of.... Crocs.

title: Why a fancy new iPhone will be a tougher sell than ever
Man who dismissed Covid-19 and then survived it says he is an example for doubters
description: For months, Tony Green was skeptical that the threat of Covid-19 was real. Then he hosted a small family gathering in June where everyone got sick.

title: How Biden's lead over Trump in polls differs from Clinton's in 2016
description: CNN's Harry Enten gives an in-depth comparison of what the polls show us about the 2020 presidential race between Joe Biden and President Donald Trump, compared to Trump's 2016 race against Hillary Clinton.

title: IMF cuts its global economic forecasts for 2021 and warns of 'long, uneven' recovery
description: A strong comeback in 2021 is needed to help the global economy heal from the coronavirus pandemic. But the International Monetary Fund is downgrading its forecasts for next year, and warning of a long, slow recovery that will stoke poverty and damage growth.

title: Trump's Supreme Court pick declined to give her views on Roe v. Wade, a landmark 1973 abortion ruling
How Ghana is reinventing itself as a top tourist destination
description: Slotted into the underbelly of Africa's northwestern huddle, Ghana is a country that's steadily reinventing itself.

title: Boris Johnson splits from his top scientists on coronavirus
Teenage 'computer genius' could become the first millennial saint
description: A teenage "computer genius" could be on the path to sainthood after he was beatified by the Catholic Church.

title: Analysis: Senate's quiet shift on religious freedom vs. abortion
description: Supreme Court confirmation hearings kicked off Monday and that arguably wasn't the biggest news event of the day.

title: How a sports psychologist helped teenager Iga Swiatek win her first tennis grand slam
description: Polish teenager Iga Swiatek says support from a sports psychologist was a key factor in helping her to win the French Open final on Saturday.

title: Opinion: Democrats are aiming for a bigger win
description: Senate Democrats are losing the battle, but they're aiming to win the war.

title: Opinion: Why the American desert is turning blue
description: For years, the Southwest shimmered like a mirage to Democrats thirsting for a political breakthrough in the desert.

title: Navy begins defusing biggest World War II bomb ever found in Poland
description: Navy divers on Monday began a five-day operation to defuse the largest unexploded World War II bomb ever found in Poland, forcing more than 750 people to evacuate their homes.

title: The world risks becoming an 'uninhabitable hell,' UN warns
description: There has been a "staggering" rise in natural disasters over the past 20 years and the climate crisis is to blame, the United Nations said Monday.

title: No more 'fake crowd noise' as fans return to the MLB for first time since March
description: Instead of fake crowd noise, baseball stars are reacquainting themselves with some old friends -- fans and the sounds they make.

title: These European countries are seeing record rises in Covid-19 cases
description: Europe is now reporting more daily infections than the United States, Brazil, or India - the countries that have been driving the global case count for months - as public apathy grows towards coronavirus guidelines. CNN's Cyril Vanier reports.

title: Nadal's French Open record is 'one of the best in sport,' rival says
description: Andy Murray thinks Rafael Nadal's 13 French Open titles is among the greatest achievements in sporting history and one that will never be topped.

title: Black History Month and the sad story of a 6-year-old boy who inspired it
description: Black History Month (BHM) is a celebration of our diversity -- all the colors of the rainbow that sparkle out of the black hole of creation. We share common roots in the dark, tropical wombs of our mothers and our strength lies in the variety within our oneness.

title: These Republican senators are distancing themselves from Trump
description: CNN's Brianna Keilar breaks down how some vulnerable Republican senators are attempting to distance themselves from President Donald Trump ahead of the 2020 election.

title: See how British police are trying to enforce coronavirus restrictions
description: The British government has instituted increased Covid-19 restrictions over the past few weeks, which many Brits appear to be ignoring. Only 89 fines have been issued for mask violations and 38 for breaking travel quarantine in England and Wales, according to the National Police Chiefs' Council. CNN's Scott McLean reports.

title: Machu Picchu opens to let one stranded tourist visit
description: Like many travelers around the world, Jesse Takayama found his dream trip thwarted by the spread of Covid-19.

title: The future of golf could be shorter than you think
description: There can surely be no greater advert for golf than an 11-year-old boy hitting a hole-in-one on the inaugural tee shot at the opening of a Tiger Woods-designed short course in front of the 15-time major winner himself.

title: Dozens killed in floods across Southeast Asia as tropical storm Nangka approaches
description: Nearly 40 people have died in Vietnam and Cambodia and scores more were missing, including rescuers, due to prolonged heavy rain and flash flooding as tropical storm Nangka edged towards the Vietnamese coast on Tuesday.

title: Pakistan's TikTok ban is not about China
description: Pakistan is taking a cue from its close ally China on internet censorship by banning, of all things, a Chinese social media app.

title: Malaysia's Anwar submits documents to king to show support to form new government
description: Malaysian opposition leader Anwar Ibrahim on Tuesday met the country's king and said he submitted documents proving his "strong and convincing" parliamentary support to form government and that Prime Minister Muhyiddin Yassin should resign.

title: Johnson & Johnson pauses Covid-19 vaccine trial after 'unexplained illness'
description: Drugmaker Johnson & Johnson said Monday it has paused the advanced clinical trial of its experimental coronavirus vaccine because of an unexplained illness in one of the volunteers.

title: This country is putting business before the environment and that could be disastrous for its rainforests
description: Last week, Indonesia's parliament passed a controversial and sweeping jobs law that environmentalists say will have a disastrous impact on the country's forests and rich biodiversity.

title: CNN speaks to Trump supporters at Florida rally: What if Trump asked you to put on a mask?
description: CNN's Gary Tuchman speaks to Trump supporters at the President's rally in Sanford, Florida, about masks and the coronavirus.

title: Regretful Trump voters: 'I got it wrong'
description: They are all nervous.
